item.title: Is LLVM the beginning of the end for GNU (as we know it)?
item.description: GNU and Richard Stallman were a real catalyst for the open source movement and its crown jewel: the Linux kernel. Not only did Mr. Torvalds’ early Linux releases had nearly 100% GNU “user-land”, he also decided to release it under the GNU Public License (GPL). GNU and Stallman are forever linked with the birth and popularization of open source, and innovated both technically and legally by turning copyright laws on their head with the copyleft licenses. The Free Software Foundation, the custodians of the GPL, is a constant source of spicy statements about the state of the software industry.
